bioghist.p: Friends Medical Society (FMS) is an informal association established in 1950 at Pendle Hill, a Quaker study center in Wallingford, Pennsylvania, to voice Quaker concerns in the field of medicine, and to act as a medical and advisory resource for the American Friends Service Committee and other national and international medical programs.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of records of the Friends Medical Society. Materials include: membership files; topical files; annual meeting agendas, correspondence, some minutes and reports; and newsletters. Topical files include such subjects as the Friends Medical Foundation; FMS's opposition to the draft; alternative service programs for conscientious objectors; and overseas relief and refugee resettlement programs. The collection also includes founding documents of the organization, news releases, and policy statements on a variety of political and social issues.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Friends Historical Library, Swarthmore College: Friends Medical Society records.
